description: CI/CD are development practices focused on the automated building, testing and deployment of software in order to improve reliability and speed
CWP allows agencies to write and publish content-based websites.
DSS is a set of standards that helps public agencies deliver digital services that are easy to use, seamless and relevant to users
DWP is a programme that aims to improve the day-to-day experience and productivity of public officers through a series of digital tools
GCC allows developers to host and build their applications on world-class technologies used by leading technology firms in the industry today.
An early-stage product used primarily for testing with end users in order to learn about its business viability
NDI consists of a series of technologies that allows citizens and businesses to leverage on a common digital identity when transacting online.
GovTech's container-based platform-as-a-service which brings stable infrastructure and rapid deployment for hosting applications within the government.
SGDS is a series of frontend components (consisting of HTML, CSS and JavaScript) that enables government agencies to build websites with a common design language.
SGTS consists of a series of common applications and platforms built by the Government that helps agencies build compliant applications easily.

TDD is a software development process that relies on the repetition of a very short development cycle: requirements are turned into very specific test cases, then the software is improved so that the tests pass
User Experience Design is a user-focused process that covers all interactions between a product and its users, including aspects of branding, design, usability and function

Vulnerability testing involves the discovery of known vulnerabilities and potential risks while penetration testing refers to the actual attempt to exploit vulnerabilities in order to expose risks in a system
